page.title: 03WESTFIELD MARINA(1), NEYLAND
page.content: On Friday 3rd May the Secretary of State and County M.P., Nicholas Edwards unveiled a plaque stating that the{Â£1.2 million}Westfield Marina was open. The Marina was built by Preseli District Council with aid from the Welsh Office and the European Economic Community. The operators Camper and Nicholsons have spent over half a million pounds equipping the Marina for the boats that they hope will come and board there.The Marina, when complete, will hold 350 boats. Govan Johns who was born and bred in Pembrokeshire, is now the manager of the Westfield Marina. He said, "The Marina which will eventually provide over 300 berths is the first in Pembrokeshire and is setting the scene for the expanding tourist industry."
